data.title: Acclaim Studios Salt Lake City Developed Games
data.meta_description: Sculptured Software specialized in port work through the 1980s. The company also produced several wrestling games for Acclaim, which published and renamed the studio in 1995.
data.text:
Piko Interactive Collection 3

May 23, 2023

EVER

The first series of Evercade cartridges to have a third installment, Piko Interactive Collection 3 contains an additional 10 games that the publisher had acquired the rights to.

ECW Anarchy Rulz

August 18, 2000

PS1

DC

Acclaim brings its third wrestling title to the Dreamcast with ECW: Anarchy Rulz. More than 60 ECW wrestlers are included in the game including Dusty Rhodes, The Sandman, and Masato Tanaka. Choose from any of the available wrestlers or create your own jump into the action in any one of the more than 25 modes of play.

NBA Jam 2000

December 2, 1999

N64

NBA Jam 2000 is a sports Nintendo 64 game made by Acclaim as licensed basketball simulation for the 1999-2000 NBA season. It also contained elements of the classic NBA Jam series in Jam Mode.

WWF In Your House

October 31, 1996

PS1

SAT

PC

The successor to WWF WrestleMania: The Arcade Game, WWF in Your House used the same style digitized sprite graphics and fast paced, over the top action.

Space Jam

January 1, 1996

PS1

SAT

PC

Based on the 1996 comedy film (of the same name) tying Looney Tunes to the real-life antics of NBA superstars, Space Jam pits players in a NBA Jam-esque basketball match as either the Monstars or the Tune Squad.

Wayne Gretzky and the NHLPA All-Stars

December 1995

GEN

SNES

Hockey game released on the Super Nintendo and Sega Genesis in 1995. Released in the year of the NHL lockout this game featured only the NHLPA license, with no NHL teams or logos.

Mortal Kombat 3

April 1, 1995

GB

GG

+ 7 more

GEN

SMS

SNES

PS1

ARC

PC

RZON

Set in a post-apocalyptic Earthrealm (invaded by Shao Kahn's army of Outworld), Mortal Kombat 3 is the third installment of one of the most violent fighting game franchises of all time.

The Ren & Stimpy Show: Time Warp

November 1994

SNES

In this Ren & Stimpy game released for the SNES, the gruesome twosome must travel through time to stop Muddy Mudskipper from changing history.

Super Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

October 1994

GB

GG

+ 2 more

SNES

WSHP

An arcade-action interpretation of the third film in the original Star Wars trilogy, as Jedi Knight Luke Skywalker and his crew must rescue Han Solo and help destroy a re-built Death Star.

Rex Ronan: Experimental Surgeon

May 1994

SNES

Rex Ronan's job is to save the life of Jake Westboro, by shrinking down to near microscopic size and removing the effects of his smoking habit.

WWF Rage in the Cage

December 21, 1993

SCD

WWF Rage in the Cage was the first and only WWF game available on the Sega CD.

Tony Meola's Sidekicks Soccer

November 1993

SNES

A soccer/football video game released for Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1993. This game is named after US goalkeeper Tony Meola, who was the American goalkeeper during the 1994 FIFA World Cup.
